How do I enable login with the Root User by editing the `/etc/ssh/sshd_config` file?

You don't enable login with the Root User by editing the `/etc/ssh/sshd_config` file, you actually disable it. To do this, you need to set `PermitRootLogin` to `no` in the file. This is a security measure to prevent unauthorized access to your system. Before making this change, make sure you have a newly created user with sudo rights, as this will ensure you can still access and manage your system.

Disable login with Root User
(make sure your newly created user login works and has sudo rights)
 `sudo nano /etc/ssh/sshd_config`
Find: PermitRootLogin yes
And set to
PermitRootLogin no
Apply new settings:
 `sudo systemctl restart sshd`
